originalText.text: Eric and his team at SOTA have been fantastic. They installed new engineered rift and quartered white oak flooring over radiant heating (Warm Board) and maneuvered around tiled surfaces as well as steel railings. Then, they re-finished and stained existing red oak flooring to match the new white oak. No matter the challenge, Eric had a solution. And, he was flexible, communicative and very friendly throughout. He and his guys are great -- we recommend them highly.

text.text: Eric and his team at SOTA have been fantastic. originalText.text: This review is long over due. Eric and his team could not have been better. We closed on Thursday afternoon and Eric and his team were in sanding down the floors Friday morning. Our plan was to go with a light natural floor. Upon sanding the team found out the original developer used two different color woods and sealed it over with a dark brown finish. Something we didn’t want. SOTA came up with a grey floor solution that we loved and was able to cover up the dark wood planks. I believe we moved into the apartment the following Thursday, only a week from closing despite the unforeseen curveball. Everyone who comes over compliments us on our floors. Thanks SOTA.

text.text: This review is long over due. Eric and his team could not have been better. We closed on Thursday afternoon and Eric and his team were in sanding down the floors Friday morning. originalText.text: I highly recommend working with SOTA. I feel so lucky that I stumbled upon them. They helped guide me through the decision process of picking hardwood flooring. They were objective and impartial, and helped me make the best decision for my needs. Then they installed the new flooring in our new apartment. This is my first time doing any kind of renovation. I worked with a contractor and SOTA. The contrast between those two relationships was striking. While my contractor was challenging to work with, Eric from SOTA was a great communicator, honest, transparent, helpful, and he frequently engaged in creative problem-solving. I could not be happier having worked with them, and the floor looks incredible. Google reviews helped me make my decision, and I hope this review can point you in the right direction as well. Eric and SOTA is an NYC treasure.

originalText.text: We had a week to get new floors installed into our newly purchased co-op before it was time to move in.  Eric Herman the president of SOTA floors personally came to see us and make his recommendations. The next day my husband and I went to choose our engineered hardwood floor at the showroom...Laura, was there to walk us though all of our choices. She patiently helped us mill through a bunch of floor choices.  Once we made our choice the floor was ordered and Eric's foreman, Joe and his crew, worked to complete the job in 4 days.  The job was not only completed in 4 days but it was done beautifully.  We have already gotten compliments on our new floors and would not hesitate to recommend this team to neighbors and friends.

originalText.text: There are flooring contractors and then there is Eric Herman at State of the Art Flooring.  I’m pleased to say that Eric is a cut above all the other contractors out there.   My situation involved a failed refinishing of a floor as a result of having a difficult wood to stain (Beech).  To determine how best to fix the problem I interviewed 5 different contractors and only Eric promised that he could solve it.   But more importantly, only Eric was willing to make the effort to understand what had gone wrong previously and then invest the time experimenting with different solutions.  He did not less than 20 samples in his laboratory and 8 samples on sight.  When one approach wasn’t working, he switched gears and spent several hours on the phone with the manufacturer of a product that ultimately worked.  Eric might cost more than other contractors, but he is worth every penny!  I wholeheartedly recommend him and his firm.
